data.prayer: Father, help your children in Dhamtari, Chhattisgarh, India find someone like the Samaritan Woman today. Someone who will open an entire town to your message of salvation.
data.verse: So the woman left her water jar and went away into town and said to the people, 29 “Come, see a man who told me all that I ever did. Can this be the Christ?” They went out of the town and were coming to him.

data.location_label: Photo from the county of Dhamtari, Chhattisgarh, India
data.section_summary: What conditions of religion or environment could you pray for here?

data.prayer: Father, see the suffering of your people in the county of Dhamtari. Deliver all those who have not forgotten your Word.
data.verse: Look on my suffering and deliver me, for I have not forgotten your law.

data.label_1: One disciple of Jesus for every 90 lost neighbors

data.prayer: Over 97.69 percent of the people of Dhamtari are far from Jesus. Lord, please send your gospel to them through the internet or radio or television today!
Spirit, please defend the 8,798 believers in Dhamtari against self-centered spirituality. Open their eyes to the fields ripe for harvest around them.

Lord, bring the blind by a way that they don’t know. Lead the Nagarchi (Hindu traditions) people in paths that they don’t know. Make darkness light before them and crooked places straight. Do not forsake the Nagarchi (Hindu traditions) people.
Spirit, disrupt complacency in the 8,798 believers living in the county of Dhamtari. Remind them you are coming soon.
data.verse: Therefore, stay awake, for you do not know on what day your Lord is coming.

data.prayer: Father, you desire the people in the county of Dhamtari who are far from you to hear about you.
data.verse: "Those who were not told about him will see, and those who have not heard will understand."

data.prayer: Father, guide the church in Dhamtari, Chhattisgarh, India to see their community as a holy priesthood, offering spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God.
data.verse: you also, like living stones, are being built into a spiritual house to be a holy priesthood, offering spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.

location.name: Dhamtari
location.people_groups_list: Muli, Brahmin Sakaldwipi, Endra, Beldar (Muslim traditions), Rajna
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Muli (20,000), Brahmin Sakaldwipi (481,000), Endra (100), Beldar (Muslim traditions) (11,000), Rajna (500)
